utterances.sentences: That's why I asked it.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: It's very simple to -- you're a nasty person, I will tell you.(LAUGHTER) (CHEERING AND APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Can you answer why you -- why you held onto the document?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Very simple.I was negotiating, and we were talking to NARA -- that's Washington -- to bring whatever they want. They can have whatever they want. When we left Washington, we had the boxes lined up on the sidewalk outside for everybody. People are taking pictures of them. Everybody knew we were taking those boxes. And the GSA, the Government Service, the GSA was the one taking them. They brought them down to Mar-a-Lago. We were negotiating with NARA. All of a sudden, they raid our house. When Biden has his documents, he won't give back the 1,850 boxes. And you're going to find some real gems in there.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: But it was Biden who alerted them that he had the documents.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: So, you...(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: ... have all these different sets of -- all these different set of...

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: The National Archives reached out to you to get your documents back.Why did you not turn them over when you got a subpoena asking for you to turn them over? TRUMP:  Because we were negotiating with them. We were negotiating with them, as per, as per the Presidential Records Act. We were negotiating with NARA.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: That's not what the Presidential Records Act says. I have seen it.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Very nice people, but they got to love our Constitution a little bit more, because -- and they shouldn't red-flag it, by the way.Very nice people. We were negotiating with NARA, and that's what the Presidential Records Act says, because Richard Nixon, surprisingly, had problems. And he had a lot of problems dealing with NARA, and they ended up passing legislation...

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Well, that's why they created...(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: ... called the Presidential Records Act just for this kind of a thing. We were dealing with them.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: My last on this -- on this subject, Mr. President...

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: But I just explained to you why.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Why? Eighteen hundred and 50 boxes.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: It's because he -- they alerted the government that they had those documents and had them come and get the documents from his house.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: OK. Why didn't -- no, he -- they didn't take them.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: My question for you, though, when it comes to documents, do you still have any classified documents in your possession?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Are you ready?

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Do you?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: No. No, I don't have anything. I have no classified documents.And, by the way, they become automatically declassified when I took them.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: No, you had to declassify them.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: But why -- let me ask you a question. Why is it that Biden had nine boxes in Chinatown? And he gets a lot of money from China.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Why is that? And why...

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: There is no evidence of that, Mr. President. No, you cannot...(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: There is no evidence of that, Mr. President

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: And why don't they put this guy Jack Smith and his group of -- and his group of thugs...

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: What you're referring to is an office that he had.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Why don't they put him in charge of that?

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Mr. President, I need to stop you right there, because there's no evidence of what you just said there.What you're referring to there is an office that he had after leaving the vice presidency.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: No, no. That's at the University of Pennsylvania.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: He had a temporary office.But I want to ask you about another investigation that you're facing.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: You're so wrong. You don't know the subject.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: I do know the subject. And I do know the facts, Mr. President.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: He had one at University of Pennsylvania, but he also had nine boxes in Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: I want to move on to another investigation that you're facing, which is the one that's happening in Georgia...

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: She doesn't understand.(LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: ... where they are investigating there your efforts to overturn the election results in the state of Georgia.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I did nothing wrong. It was a perfect phone call.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: At the center of that -- let me finish my question.At the center of that is that call that you had with the secretary of state...

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Perfect call.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: ... Brad Raffensperger.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Yes, sure.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Given the fact that there are indictments expected to come in that case this summer, is that a call you would make again today?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Yes, I called questioning the election. I thought it was a rigged election. I thought it had a lot of problems.I had every -- I guess he's secretary of state. I called -- listen to this. There are like seven lawyers on the call, many of them from there. We're having a call. We're having a normal call. Nobody said, oh, gee, he shouldn't have said that. Why -- if this call was bad -- I questioned the election.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: You asked him to find you votes.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: If this call was bad -- I didn't ask him to find anything.Let me just tell you...

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: We have heard the audiotape, Mr. President. There's an audio of you asking him to find you 11,000-something votes.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: ... if this call was bad -- I said, you owe me votes because the election was rigged. That election was rigged.And if this call was bad, why didn't him and his lawyers hang up? How dare you say that? This was a perfect phone call.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Well, they were clearly concerned enough they recorded the call.And I should note that, of course...

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: This was a call that was made to question the results of election.And we have -- and when we can't make a call to question election results, then this country ought to just forget about it. (CHEERING AND APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: You weren't just questioning the election results.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I was questioning the election.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: You were asking him to find you votes.And I should note that there is no evidence of fraud. There is no rigged election in the state of Georgia. I want to get back to the audience, though, Mr. President, because those are false claims you're making about what happened in Georgia. John -- Jordan Sullenberger is here. He's an undeclared voter from Hollis. He voted for you in 2020. Jordan, what is your question for President Trump tonight?

utterances.speaker: JORDAN SULLENBERGER, MILITARY VETERAN
utterances.sentences: Thank you, Mr. Trump.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Thank you very much.

utterances.speaker: SULLENBERGER
utterances.sentences: I'm 26. I'm a veteran. I help manage a private aviation company.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: You want a job?

utterances.speaker: SULLENBERGER
utterances.sentences: I'd love one, yes.(LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I'm looking -- I'm looking for somebody very good.

utterances.speaker: SULLENBERGER
utterances.sentences: I -- I'm not for mandates or government interference in private business.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: SULLENBERGER
utterances.sentences: But I have seen Republicans going after us, like DeSantis, after Disney.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: SULLENBERGER
utterances.sentences: What would you do as president to protect us from government interference?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Well, I'm the one that really wants to protect you.All of these fake investigations of me are about election interference. They think, because I'm leading Biden by 11 points, seven points, nine points, I'm leading DeSanctimonious by a lot... (LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: ... by 40 points or 45 points. I think he ought to just relax and take it easy and think about the future, because, right now, his future is not looking so good.I will tell you this. We are really putting it to Biden, but he's putting it to himself, because the economy stinks, inflation is horrible, and the border is a disaster. And, by the way, the way he got out of Afghanistan was the single most embarrassing moment in the history of our country. (CHEERING AND APPLAUSE) COLLINS:  Mr. President, I have one more question for you here tonight. And I think, while we're in front of the voters here in New Hampshire -- in New Hampshire, this is a fundamental question for you. You are running in the 2024 race. If you are the Republican nominee and you are in that 2024 race, will you commit tonight to accepting the results of the 2024 election?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Yes, if I think it's an honest election, absolutely, I would.(CHEERING AND APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Will you commit to accepting the results of the election regardless of the outcome?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Do you want me to answer it again?If I think it's an honest election, I would be honored to. And, right now, we are so far ahead of both Democrat and Republican. And you know what? If I don't win, this country is going to be in big trouble. It's so sad to see what's happening. (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: But no commitment there on the -- accepting the results regardless of the outcome?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: It's -- if it's an honest election, correct, I would.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: OK, so not committing to accepting the 2020 election results or acknowledging what happened in 2020.(LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: President Trump, I want to thank you for coming here tonight.This is an important conversation with voters to hear and to have. Thank you to our audience and to our host, Saint Anselm College. (CHEERING AND APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: CNN's coverage continues with Anderson Cooper and Jake Tapper.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Thank you.(CHEERING AND APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Thank you very much.Thank you very much, Kaitlan. Good job. (CROSSTALK) (CHEERING AND APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Thanks, everyone.
